results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 07
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. The RAAF flight in the Antarctic use Canadian “Beaver” aircraft. 2. RAAF personnel are trained by firemen in Melbourne. 3. The Lockheed Hercules transport. 4. The “Jindivik” pilotless aircraft, designed and built in Australia, shown in flight at Woomera range.

results.title: Planning for Melbourne's future
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: In 1949 the Melbourne Metropolitan Board of Works was asked to formulate a plan that would estimate the future needs of Melbourne. From information gathered through surveys, inspecting every street and alley to determine its use, this was made possible. “Planning for Melbourne’s Future” is photographed and directed by Geoffrey Thompson and is an examination of this plan. It is a rare and honest account of the deficiencies and lack of planning made to prepare Melbourne for an increase in future population growth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 04
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Kip and David”.
David and his elfin friend Kip discover many surprises while playing in the garden. A green tree frog hidden in a plant, a shady Traveller’s palm and newly grown mushrooms - ideal stools for Kip. As they search for a dry, sheltered home for Kip, they see bearded dragon and frilled lizards. After clearing a site at the foot of a tree, they draw a plan and prepare to build it. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: Kip and David. Episode 03
results.creator_credit: Arthur Cantrill, Corinne Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Kip and David”.
On the last day of his holiday at Stradbroke Island, David wakes early, feeds the wild horses, then goes for a swim with Kip, the bushland elf. Later they build a sand castle together and slide down the sand dunes before David smuggles Kip in his bag for a holiday in Brisbane. Music by Nancy Tow. Narrated by Roy Dunlop.

results.title: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

video_links.name: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

results.brief_description: Shows how the three aims of controlled irrigation can be achieved in furrow irrigation by putting the “correct flow” down the furrows so as to obtain even distribution of the water over the whole area and down to the depth of the root zone. The various factors which determine “correct flow” are briefly considered and finally the method whereby it may be obtained and checked is outlined.
results.title_for_label: The Importance of flow in furrow irrigation

results.title: Glassmakers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A survey of the wide range of glass products manufactured by British craftsmen. Includes manufacture of plate glass and installation of a large sheet in one of the Festival of Britain buildings; making of stained glass windows; manufacture of optical glass and lenses; prisms and lanterns for lighthouses; production of electric light globes; glass blowing and making of nahd0made cut glass.

results.title: The Daydreamer
results.brief_description: An example of independent Melbourne film production. A young man watching a girl pass by his window, imagines himself the hero in a series of fantastic situations in which the maiden’s honour is threatened by diverse evil characters. Made by Michael Martin, assisted by Garry Martin, Bruce McNaughton and Doug Hobbs.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Killian and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: This is a tribute to the Australians who sailed Gretel” in the America’s Cup…” Traces the construction of the Australian challenger, “Gretel”, its trials in America, and finally its efforts in the America’s Cup yacht races.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: The Burnie story
results.creator_credit: Associated Pulp and Paper Manufacturers and Cine Service
results.brief_description: The township of Burnie on the north-west coast of Tasmania with a population of 14,000 is the centre of the thriving pulp and paper manufacturing industry. This industry started in 1936 and produces from the forests in the surrounding country, not only timber for the building industry but from the timber waste all types of cardboard, and wrapping paper and even high-grade printing paper. The film shows the up-to-date and powerful machinery which is used from the time a tree is felled until the final paper product is shipped from the Burnie wharves. Afforestation is maintained to ensure the raw material will not be exhausted. Photography: Geoffrey Thompson. Narrated by Ray Chapman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Associated Pulp and Paper Manufacturers and Cine Service
